Posts.Content: Jul 13, 2008 01:20PM Ivylane wrote: I don't buy any of these stats.... in 1991 after round 1, I was told less than 10% chance of reccurrence....  my onc (at the time) said "cancer is an  insidious disease...I have seen people die who should have lived, and I have seen people live that should have died"...  I never DID have a reccurrence, but I DID get another new primary BC in the other breast 15 years later....go figure.... I think it's 50/50 any way you look at it....by the way, I am not having a round three thank you very much.... I plan on being around a long time...a lot of treatment changes occur over the years and it seems that every year there is a new treatment option.... hang in there everyone!
Posts.Title: 80 % chance of it coming back!!! Naomi browneyes2323

Posts.Content: Nov 3, 2008 08:04AM Ivylane wrote: Kelly...this is a tough one.  I don't think hiding it from them is a good idea, but telling them on a need to know basis is probably something to think about.  My kids were 6 and 4-1/2 at my first dx....I told them the same thing you did, mommy had to take medicine and go to physical therapy (radiation) ...this time they were 22 and 20 so there was no need to worry about that....it was still very tough though....they were scared. If your son knows something is up then I think you need to say something. Have you spoken about cancer to them at all?   Sometimes what they think is much worse than what you tell them.  I'm no expert that's for sure, but you may want to tell them that "mommy is sick again" and will probably be taking medicine that makes her lose her hair.  I don't know, JMO Good luck Kelly..... by the way the kids are gorgeous and your little puppy looks like my "toto"
